IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of trees near our overhead cables. This has identified trees that have grown close to 23 spans of electricity cables, which could damage the cables and affect your electricity supply. Our engineers need to safely cut the trees away from the cables. During this time, you will be connected to a generator to provide you with electricity whilst we carry out the works. To connect and disconnect the generator we will need to switch off your power temporarily. This work will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate that some customers have experienced an unplanned power cut in the last 6 months. This work is taking place in and around Brandon County Park, near Bury Road.

This has identified pieces of equipment called switchgear and a transformer that needs upgrading. Once the work is completed, this will improve the reliability of the network, improve restoration times in the event of an unplanned power cut along with reducing the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. During this time, you will be connected to a generator to provide you with electricity whilst we carry out the works. To connect the generator we will need to switch off your power temporarily. This work is taking place in the Lower Street area.

Steps.Message: Sent by Simon at 09:02 - We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, we appreciate how disruptive this must be for you, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Simon at 07:34 - Our engineers have advised us that in order to continue their works on the underground cable fault safely, they have had to turn off power to further properties in the area. Our estimated time of 09:00-10:00 hasn't changed. If you'd like more information about why we sometimes have to switch power off to work; here's a short video https://bit.ly/3cYez0V. We'll keep you updated with progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: This is a message from UK Power Networks at [TIME]. We own and maintain the electricity cabling in London, East Anglia, and the Southeast. We have an ongoing network issue which has affected power to some properties in your area. Our engineers have advised that in order to continue their repairs on this underground cable fault safely, they have turned power off to 40 properties. We're sorry we haven't been able to provide you with prior warning, but this is emergency work and may affect public safety. If your electricity is affected by this, you can get live updates on the incident through our website here - http://www.ukpowernetworks.co.uk/power-cut/incident?incidentid=[INCIDENTID].
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Name: Reported

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by David at 23:25
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have now arrived on site in the Nicholls Close area.

As any issues that currently exist on our network have affected our equipment at the substation, engineers will start their testing there. They will then check our network equipment throughout the area to try and identify any problems, before trying to restore power.

Our estimated time frame of 01:30-02:30 hasn't changed, but if this is not successful it's possible that a cable repair may be needed. As soon as our staff can safely update us, we'll give you the latest news. Sent by David at 23:16.

Sent by Roland at 19:16 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers have made partial repairs on the underground network in the Kent Gardens area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Following on from our previous message, we can now confirm we have switched power off. This is to allow our engineers to safely excavate and repair a faulty underground cable. We're now estimating to have the power back on between 19:30 and 20:30. We'll keep sending text updates to everyone until all the power to your area is on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry to say we may need to turn the power off again in this area. Our engineers have found another fault on the underground network which will need to be excavated and repaired. We'll work as quickly and safely as possible to get everything back on once the repairs are complete.

With darkness now upon us we understand that it can be unsettling to have a power cut. It may help to locate a torch and anything else you may need so you can have it to hand just in case.

If you have any concerns please do not hesitate to contact our team, but we will work to fix the problem as quickly and safely as possible. Sent by Roland at 18:09.

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 22:44 - Hi David here again. We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 43 customers in the Shepherds Grove Park IP31 2 area, by diverting power around a faulted piece of overhead network equipment. We know your power may have been off for a long time, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 22:07 - Thanks for your patience this evening.

Our staff are checking our equipment throughout the area to pinpoint the issue on our overhead cabling network. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, this is David - I wanted to let you know I have just taken over for the night shift, so I'll be here until tomorrow morning making sure you have the latest news from our staff.

I know that power being off may be especially worrying for you as we head later into the evening, but our field teams work 24 hours so I'll let know further news as soon as it comes in.
